name: Vigilus
overview:
Vigilus is an IBM/ Lotus Notes & BlackBerry application development with a core competency in CRM solutions. (www.vigilus.net)

Below is background on ACT! for Notes (AFN) and Vigilus.

ACT! for Notes (AFN)
AFN is a simple, but powerful CRM application that allows one or more users to share information about: a. Companies
b. Contacts
c. Opportunities
d. Activities
e. Notes

AFN gives users the ability to: a. Integrate with Lotus Notes Calendar and E-Mail b. Send & store emails from within AFN c. Send & store Broadcast Emails d. Share vital information across an enterprise e. Track opportunities and forecasts in real time f. Targeted Marketing campaigns g. Create Reports h. Have Off-line and Web Interface i. Have BlackBerry integration

There are many AFN tools and utilities that allow users to: a. Associate Activities, Notes, Outbound and Inbound emails to an Opportunity as well as the associated Contact b. Synchronize the AFN and Notes Mail calendar on a user-by-user basis c. Link or associate Contacts to one or more Companies d. Apply data and security changes to many selected documents at one time

AFN has been in existence since the mid 1990’s and is mature and stable. The application has retained itsâ€™ core functionality and countless improvements have been added since its inception.

AFN is a single Lotus Notes database that can be installed either on PC/Laptop or a Server. An AFN user can sync (â€œreplicateâ€) between the local copy and the server copy.

ACT! for Notes is scalable (we have clients with over 400,000 documents) and extensible, meaning it can easily integrated with other Lotus Notes applications.

Target Market Generally speaking, any organizations that have an IBM/Lotus Notes infrastructure are considered potential candidates for AFN.

AFN is not an application specific to one particular industry. We have users in all major business sectors including:

  • Financial services
  • Construction
  • Publishing
  • Manufacturing
  • Healthcare
  • Transportation
  • Energy
